content: easy victorian shell mitts yarn - 2 skeins knit picks main line dusty lavender pictured or 160 yds of any aran/worsted weight yarn hook - g skill level - easy peasy size - one size fits most however you can make the mitts smaller by crocheting 4 fewer row on the wrist ribbing 4 row = 2 row of rib = 1 shell and 1 double_crochet you can size them up by adding 4 row of single_crochet on the wrist ribbing thereby adding 2 row of rib one shell and 1 double_crochet in the body of the mitts you ll need to adjust your shell/double_crochet count accordingly in the body of the pattern matching nail polish - optional wink pattern stitches used - beginning shell = ch3 double_crochet ch1 2 double_crochet in same space shell - 2 double_crochet ch1 2 double_crochet in same space gauge - 3 shells/3 double_crochet in pattern = 4 7 row of shells = 4 finished size 4 wide in lace portion 7 1/2 long bottom of ribbing to top of lace pattern chain 10 note for row 1 through 22 in wrist ribbing single_crochet in back loop only row 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet in each chain across chain 1 turn 9 single_crochet row 2 - it really won t make a difference you now have 6 shell/double_crochet combos around note you can make the mitts long or shorter here simply crochet more shell row if you want them longer fewer if you want them shorter shell row 2 -
